abstract.text: The

protocol eliminates the need to use explicit image types for the image input ports on your custom patch. Not only does using the protocol avoid restrictions of a specific image type, but it avoids impedance mismatches, and provides better performance by deferring pixel computation until it is needed. When you need to access the pixels in an image, you simply convert the image to a representation (texture or buffer) using one of the methods defined by the
protocol. Use a texture representation when you want to use input images on the GPU. Use a buffer representation when you want to use input images on the CPU.

abstract.text: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.
A layer that loads, plays, and controls Quartz Composer compositions in a Core Animation layer hierarchy.
The

class allows users to browse compositions that are in the Quartz Composer composition repository, and to preview them. You can set the default input parameters for a composition preview  by using the method setDefaultValue:forInputKey:.
The
protocol defines the methods used to pass data to the input ports or retrieve data from the output ports of the root patch of a Quartz Composer composition. This protocol is adopted by the
, and
classes.
Performs the processing or rendering tasks appropriate for the custom patch.
The
protocol defines methods that you use only from within the execution method (
) of a
object.
The

protocol eliminates the need to use explicit image types for the image input ports on your custom patch. Not only does using the protocol avoid restrictions of a specific image type, but it avoids impedance mismatches, and provides better performance by deferring pixel computation until it is needed. When you need to access the pixels in an image, you simply convert the image to a representation (texture or buffer) using one of the methods defined by the
protocol. Use a texture representation when you want to use input images on the GPU. Use a buffer representation when you want to use input images on the CPU.
Binds the texture to a given texture unit and optionally scales or flips the texture.
Returns the base address of the image buffer.
Returns the  bytes per row of the buffer representation.
Returns the color space of the image buffer representation.
Returns the pixel format of the image buffer representation.
Returns the height of the image buffer representation.
Returns the width of the image buffer representation.
Returns the actual bounds of the image source expressed in pixels and aligned to integer boundaries.
Returns the color space of the image source.
Creates a memory buffer representation from a subregion of the image source using the provided pixel format and color space.
Creates an OpenGL texture representation from a subregion of the image source using the provided color space.
Returns whether or not the image source should be color matched.
Returns the color space of the texture representation.
Returns whether or not the contents of the texture are flipped vertically.
Returns a texture matrix.
Returns the texture name.
Returns the height of the texture representation.
Returns the width of the texture representation.
Returns the texture target.
Unbinds the texture from a texture unit.
Releases the memory buffer representation of the image source.
Releases the OpenGL texture representation of the image source.
The

protocol eliminates the need to use explicit image types for the image output ports on a custom patch. The methods in this protocol are called by the Quartz Composer engine when the output image is needed. If your custom patch has an image output port, you need to implement the appropriate methods for rendering image data and to supply information about the rendering destination and the image bounds.
A base class for low-level rendering.
The
class is a custom
class that loads, plays, and controls Quartz Composer compositions. It is an autonomous view that is driven by an internal timer running on the main thread.
A protocol for composition parameter views delegate.
The
informal protocol defines methods that allow  your application to respond to changes in a composition picker view (a
object).
